page.title: 03ENDURING RURAL LIFE & LAND
page.content:
This predominantly agriculture area has remained relatively uchanged since the last Domesday survey: an area of gentle prosperity rather than wealth.
Some of the rural quiet was removed in World War II when an extensive complex of aircraft repair workshops was built. The buildings remain but they now form an industrial estate with many different trades represented.
The sole "public building" is the Anglican Parish Church, largely rebuilt in the 19th century only the lower part of the tower remains of the previous building.
